anyone awake ?: ok ... so i'm trying to connect to a ubuntu box and ssh doesnt wanna play. i suspect that sshd isnt even started or installed. if we omit the fact that one can know whether a fresh ubuntu comes with or without sshd, how does one check whether its running in *nix ?
a fresh install has no sshd
install the openssh-server package
ok ... but let me be more clear: if we forget for a second that both you and i know that a fresh ubuntu has no sshd. How would i check if its running or not ?
and by the way: when i install the openssh-server package ... will it also be added to some sort of startup-file, so that its always started on boot ?
sorry - got called away
np
ps aux | grep sshd <-- will tell you if it is running
and yes, the install will set up scripts in /etc/init.d and /etc/rc*.d to start sshd on boot :)
yup, got a response similar to that by someone else here ... thanks
ok great
k - i got called away and didn't read my scrollback closely
if the current version of a package is still on the install CD it will install from that (saves time/bandwidth)
ah shite ... ok ... hmmm  could i override this?
edit your sources.list and comment out the "deb cdrom" line (usually at the top)
ah ofcourse ... sounds logical. will try
then apt-get update
worked like a charm, got sshd installed and running and can connect!
thanks for help
